website_summaries.verdict: With corded power for endless run time and a 13-inch cutting width, this model is the best way to finish large jobs quickly.
pros: Because users do not have to worry about draining batteries from their charge, this corded unit will work as long as they do
The 5 amp motor exceeds the power of most battery-powered models, and the 13-inch cutting width is the biggest of any model we considered
For users with big jobs that require a lot of power, this unit is a good option
cons: Obviously, the need for an outlet limits the distance this model can be used away from the home, so it may not work well for jobs at the edges of large lawns

customer_reviews.title: Typical 3-prong extension cord won't fit
customer_reviews.text: For some unfathomable reason, the thoughtless designers (this is what you get when you replace engineering with marketing "design") made the power plug completely recessed, and the recess is too small to fit your typical 3-prong extension cord. Of course, like any sensible person, I don't have 50- or 100-foot 2-prong extension cords lying around, and the ones I do have have a 3-receptacle tap which also won't fit. So, I have to make a trip to the hardware store, or perhaps more sensibly remove enough material that my regular outdoor extension cord fits. 1 star for wasting my time, reasonless.
customer_reviews.author: marshaul

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SENIORS
customer_reviews.text: Very Lightweight, easy pre-wound line to snap on (my favorite feature), and does a super job on tall and short growth, very powerful. After battling with a Craftsman for a year, I'm in heaven. I'm in my late 60s and its so lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkyrat

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use three prong extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to use as equipped with the Amazon recommended 100’ 3 prong extension cord. The problem is the trimmer was designed to block three prong extension cords. Without the ability to plug the trimmer into a three prong extension it is useless without finding an extension cord from the 1980s.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmos

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a trimmer that I thought would put me in the grave from trying to untangle the line. This trimmer has auto feed... and I don't need to tap or hammer it on the ground to release the line.... It seems to really whirl along through the weeds and reedy grasses. The guard seems good, too. I haven't massacred my shins and legs yet. All in all, I am impressed with this trimmer. If only it would run itself.... and quit whacking my ferns by mistake... or is that operator error?
customer_reviews.author: kphaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: The auto feed system is wasteful
customer_reviews.text: The auto feed system seems to be very wasteful. The very first time I used this weed wacker, I finished the entire spool before I finished half of the yard work. I don't have a very big yard and it would cost way too much money to constantly replace these spools. I'm returning this item and buying a weed wacker that has a bump controlled system instead.
customer_reviews.author: Youssef

customer_reviews.title: Uses string too fast!
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this weed eater until I saw how fast it uses the string! I went through 2 1/2 rolls in 2 hours! My old trimmer would last month's. I'm not sure if it is because of the automatic feed or what. The other feature were great. Edgar worked great when you flip it over. Adjustable handle is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Self feeding head works awesome !
customer_reviews.text: Bought this trimmer to replace the cheaper Black and Decker model under this one that died at a young age I have a 20v cordless B&D trimmer with the same auto feed head that has never failed to feed in over 2 years of tough use. This electric model works like a champ and powers through everything I've thrown at it within reason. 100% satisfied with delivery, price and product.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Bad Handle Design, Bad String Feed
customer_reviews.text: Powerful as hell ......... really tears stuff up, IMPRESSIVE. String feed needs reworked, this thing goes through string like a fat kid goes through Hostess products. The handle, forward hand grab is ridiculous in that it won't tighten .....at about the same interval you'll need to replace string, the handle will slip. Constant adjustment needed so I'll have to engineer a solution to permanently fix the handle in place. Just added a pic on how I modified the thing, handle slipping. Drilled through body, carabiner and a zip tie. BOOM !!!
customer_reviews.author: ROCK

customer_reviews.title: Does not plug into a normal outdoor extension cord
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine once up and running. But there is no way to plug in a normal outdoor extension cord. I went to two hardware stores trying to find an adapter or a 2 prong extension cord.. I eventually had to shave away part of the plastic to get an extension cord to fit. I have absolutely no idea when B&D would make a product that is virtually unusable without taking a razor to it. And NO WHERE in the description does it say it will not work with a normal 3 prong outdoor extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: As noted in other ratings the auto string feed is ...
customer_reviews.text: As noted in other ratings the auto string feed is worthless. Will spin out the whole spool after just minimal trimming. As all brands use basically the same feed system i am sure they are all about the same. You can put tape over auto feed lever but this will require you to open up spool and feed out line manually when needed, this is where i am at. Junk.....
customer_reviews.author: murph

customer_reviews.title: Eats trimmer line!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but boy does it eat trimmer string! I am aware of the cautionary note in the instructions to be careful that the string doesn't hit a hard surface (concrete, asphalt, etc.), but that's exactly where my lawn abuts the sidewalk and driveway. So as careful as I am, a spool of trimmer string might last as little as 10' to 25'. I went through three spools in literally minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Rdurof

customer_reviews.title: The fact that a standard 3 prong outdoor extension cord doesn't fit in the recess is just dumb. Product was also sold by amazon as new ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give -1 stars if that were an option. The fact that a standard 3 prong outdoor extension cord doesn't fit in the recess is just dumb. Product was also sold by amazon as new but was obviously open box. Worked OK after cutting off enough material to get a 3 prong plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not any good
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, I did everything exactly right but kept having line thrown out at my legs at the speed of pight now covered in blood blisters. The automatic feeder line sucks! Sending back an buying different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Andy n' Crystal Morris

customer_reviews.title: Spin fast but doesn’t cut anything
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used one said to be “like new.” It is. Arrived in the original box (although box is damaged). Item looked to be unused or lightly used, just a bit dust all around. Easy set up, but when comes to actual using, it spins smoothly but cuts nothing. Checked the lines, can’t figure out what went wrong. Planning to return and get a new one if I still can’t get it to work in the next few days.
customer_reviews.author: AMZShopper

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous item
customer_reviews.text: Needed a string cutter to manage less than 100 ft in the backyard. The problem is the auto feeder on this unit releases string at the slightest resistance - be it a brick edging, tough weed or wooden fence. The lengthened string then hits the cut off knife sending fragments of string flying - including into exposed legs. The entire spool was spent after less than ten feet. Because the spool releases too easily, it does not cut through grass at the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Steve

customer_reviews.title: Returning after one use.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, very disappointed. Tried it today and ended up using my 25- year-old B&D trimmer/ edge that is held together with duct tape and worked better than this one. Main issue? In the edging position, the guide is so high that no matter how I tilted it, I couldn't edge. Had to put in weed whacker position, hold it vertical, and try to edge. Not only awkward, and guide kept slipping down, but now I have marks on my legs from where stuff flew out and bruised me. Yes, I was wearing long pants.
customer_reviews.author: wizard

customer_reviews.title: Weak cutting string, jams every 10 seconds
customer_reviews.text: Just a lousy product, but I suspect the entire category, with its string capsule, is worthless. I would go 10 seconds before the string would break, and then the wrapped innards would jam, forcing me to take off the entire capsule and unwind the spool enough to feed the string back through the hole. Lousy, lousy product. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 22 months later...off to the trashcan!  What a frustrating tool!!
customer_reviews.text: 100% crap! I like to think I'm a fair and reasonable reviewer and rarely leave negative reviews, but this Black & Decker string trimmer is virtually unusable! I just threw it in the trash after manually pulling out line every 30 seconds (no exaggeration!) to finish my trimming today. My wife and I have put up with this ridiculousness for almost 2 years and enough is enough! Whoever designed this auto-feed system should be fired! Because there are so many 4-star reviews, I'm wondering if I got a bad one or it has just worn down after every use. I need to find a "bump-feed" trimmer and would never buy another "auto-fee" trimmer!!
customer_reviews.author: thegman

customer_reviews.title: Eats the string like you won't believe
customer_reviews.text: I have owned sever B&D trimmers over the years. This one eats an entire reel of string with each use on a very small yard. On the previous models it took a couple of months to do this. Avoid this unless you want to purchase the string by the case!
customer_reviews.author: chowim

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small yard about 5 feet wide and 30 foot long. My last weed eater lasted me 10 years and wish it would have died sooner cause this unit is twice as powerful as my old one around same price and I cut my lawn in half the time and replacing the cord seem really easier but with my small lawn shouldn't have to do for a while. Only issue, is the electrically plug on the unit because it is two prong and housing around prongs is very small. My extension cord end would not fit into because to big. Luckily had a two to three prong adapter and plug it end and work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm 67 years old and needed something I could handle. I pulled it out of the box, put it together, pluged it into a 50 foot 14AWG cord and trimmed the entire yard very quickly. The trimmer string broke off in the first 10 feet. I thought, oh no, but I just removed the cover, pulled out some string and didn't stop until I had finished the entire yard. I am impressed and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Burnie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I had read a lot of the reviews. I have no problem with the weed wacker. One person shows he/her legs all cut up. Any weed wacker will do that. Dress accordingly and this won't happen It was simple to put together. I also read some complaints about the self feed. And I read the review about how to solve this problem. I did exactly what it said. No problem with the self feed And I was amazed by how much power this had I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Terri Mcmanus

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this on april 10. thirty day money back ended may 10. it split in half at the seams and is no longer usable from nnormal use on may 21. so much for that wasted money. i am so sick of companies that manufacture crap that doesnt even last two months of normal use.... companies that sell me this type of crap can all rot.
customer_reviews.author: dodybe

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty...light jobs only.
customer_reviews.text: Item worked while it worked for three weeks, then abruptly stopped. Plastic gear melted. Not very thick weeds, mostly crab grass to tall for mower. Recommend for extremely light jobs only.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Rick

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent...updated o 9/5/18.
customer_reviews.text: Used for the 1st time today. Powerful little sucker. My only fuss, the string ran out quick...but thts an easy fix. Ordering more now. Updated: 9/5/18. I used trimmer last week; like one person said, the handle keeps adjusting when in used. Not a major deal breaker, but this should not happen.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your hard earned money!
customer_reviews.text: Less than 5 weeks of having this, it has stopped working. Was a birthday gift for my husband. Very disappointing. Of course don't have the original packaging so can't return. Should have bought thru local store at least then I could have gotten an exchange. So frustrated as Black & Decker to used to be a reliable product. $45 wasted. 😡☹️👎🏼
customer_reviews.author: Susan K

customer_reviews.title: A great trimmer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I bought this expecting a cheaply made trimmer, but this is a really well constructed, tough tool. A little heavier than my last "cheap" trimmer but very well made & easy to handle. A doddle to put together & worked great right out of the box. Came with a 0.65 line that made very short work of a tough, large patch of weeds in our side yard, this thing is a beast compared to my last trimmer, well worth the $40. Very pleased with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Theexbrit

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a complainer, in fact this is my very first bad review. I used it 3 times in my tiny back yard and ran out of string. It would constantly feed string, making it fly off the weed trimmer. It's down right dangerous! I've had two other weed trimmers and never have seen anything like this one! I wish I had saved the box to return it. I didn't give it away because I didn't want anyone to get hurt, so I threw it out for garbage. Buyer beware - this is a horrible weed trimmer!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Manos

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: My black and decker weedeater stopped working after 5 years. Thought I was ordering the same model but this one is different and was a huge mistake. I go thru 1 spool every time. The handle is worthless. It won’t stay tight and slips while trimming causing jagged edges. I would have returned it but didn’t have the box. Love B&D products but this one should be taken off shelves.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: This will be my last B&D purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just received & used right out of the box (after screwing on the protector). Great price because I know with this particular brand I'll be replacing in about 3 years anyway. **Update 7-17 after a full yard use (1st time was remnants left from last broken unit), previous reviews nailed it. This is the worst trimmer on string use! I have a small yard & went thru 4 spools of string. Got tired of restringing. I've used twice & looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette

customer_reviews.title: Not your father's trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is the best trimmer I've ever owned. And it's unbelievably cheap. The trimmer head rotates to the position you want so that you don't have to hold the device upside down. The guard sits perfectly on the ground and hugs your border so you can easily get a perfect trim. The line auto feeds when you need it without banging the unit on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Two prong attachment that doesn't fit some 3-prong extension cords
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you probably have a long outdoor extension cord with a 3-prong molded receptacle on the end. It's probably orange, right? Well, the power connector on this is only two prong, which is fine, but what's not fine is that there's a plastic shroud around the two prong connector that prevents it from mating with my extension cord. It's fine, I can cut away the plastic shroud and make it work. But this seems to me to be a design flaw and I would buy something different next time so I don't have to worry about that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Needs two prong extension cord!!!
customer_reviews.text: What idiot decided that it was a good idea to make an outdoor tool that would not accept a three-prong extension cord??!! Never been a real fan of Black and Decker, but I figured for the little bit of trimming I had to do in the yard, I would try it. Granted, it is lightweight and it does trim well, but if I can't plug it in it is really useless. Finally, trimmed down the plastic on a three prong plug so it would plug into the trimmer. Ok for now, but will never buy ANYTHING from Black and Decker again!
customer_reviews.author: Woolleylady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted a lightweight weedeater that I could carry around and use without my arms killing. This is it! This thing will tear through salmonberry bushes without hesitation. I did find that the first time I used it that I went through the spool of the line pretty quickly, so I bought a big spool from our local hardware store and replenish the line myself when it runs out (it seems to be lasting longer). Definitely happy that I bought it
customer_reviews.author: SnowPrincess

customer_reviews.title: Constantly runs out of string.  Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: Eats your string up like there is no tomorrow. I live on a corner lot with a sidewalk. I used 4 spools and still did not get the sidewalk done. You would go broke buying spools of string. It is powerful. Not too bad to handle. The edge guide is adjustable however it won't stay in place where you set it. Might as well not waste your time adjusting it. I am returning it and definitely not buying another Black and Decker. The way it eats up your spool of string in ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: PKS

customer_reviews.title: Weeds
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about buying this product for two reasons. 1. It’s electric, I just didn’t think it would have the power as a gas powered tool and 2 the price being so low, I just thought it was too good to be true. I tested it out at my parents house and I used it for almost 4 straight hours. I ran out of string pretty quick, but this tool really held up and did it’s job. I’m extremely impressed with this tool. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who’s in the market for the weed wacker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Out does my more expensive weed whackers
customer_reviews.text: Two years, still holding up This weedwacker is cutting down thick stem weeds and does not heat up like my more expensive trimmers But, I don't push it, give it a rest to cool off while I do other yardwork as I have burned up many other trimmers I think the manufactures get their money off of the 'string' If I hit a rock or a sapling tree, it feeds out line.. I took one point off for maneuverability, because the handle is not adjustable, that I can find? I have to find ways to handle the machine giving my shoulder and arm a rest
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and seemed all good. It ran out of zip in less than an hour 🤦🏻‍♀️ Oh puhlease! Sent it back pronto👎👎
customer_reviews.author: gloria

customer_reviews.title: The product doesn't work!!
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this product easy line like a hungry dog, now the line feeder doesn't work. This Black and Decker product is a disgrace! I've worked with B&D products for years but this one takes the cake. You say I can't send it back, but I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Don W

customer_reviews.title: Auto feed needs to be re-engineered.
customer_reviews.text: Like some others, mine was going through line at a ridiculous rate. I put in .80 line and taped the cam lever down. Yeah, I have to manually advance the line, but the line lasts sooooooooo much longer. I like the power this has.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Seawright

customer_reviews.title: Spool is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Its light weight and the ability to trim different ways is great. However the autofeed is a nightmare. I've had this since May and every time I use it, there is always a struggle with the autofeed. I've unwound a brand new spool just to ensure the line is straight as possible, and it is still a problem. Which pretty much makes this small investment useless. I'd recommend saving a little more money for a more reliable trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Romero

customer_reviews.title: Unable to remove head
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great. Really powerful. Downside is maintenance. There is no easy way to remove the head of anything gets wound or trapped inside. Spools are super easy to change, but if you get twine, wire, anything stuck under the head and have to take it apart to remove it, it's over. I spent over an hour after getting a small piece of wire caught in it trying to remove it and trying to remove the head to clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my 3-yr old, very-inexpensive string trimmer. I decided to spend a little more, and am very glad that I did. The trimmer seems solidly built, is lightweight, and comfortable for me to use. It's fast and efficient in handling regular lawn trimming, as well as tackling taller weeds in small meadow patches. Haven't had to add new string yet (that's usually the make-or-break aspect for me....), but I can see the spool assembly looks sturdier than my previous unit.
customer_reviews.author: kym

customer_reviews.title: Nope! Don't get!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your time on this!!! So frustrating! Used up the whole spool of trimmer line in 15 min with the autofeed. Went to store, got more line, went to rewind spool, spring inside cap and the small black feeder bar going flying off into the undergrowth. It is useless without these! No replacements included, you have to buy them! Spent $50 and two hours to get 15 min of trimming done! Do not buy with the autofeed!!!
customer_reviews.author: marykathryn maceoin

customer_reviews.title: Great little trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer i am 5'2 and love that i can adjust it to a comforyable height for me easy to change reels light enough for this woman to use but study little work horse i trimmed some really tough stuff with it for hours today it kept right up. Many haf noted needing to duck tape over the autifed or they went through string I was prepared yo do this but do far have not needed to . I am impressed with this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: jackie gerard

customer_reviews.title: pretty simple and straight forward
customer_reviews.text: two parts to assemble very easy purchased this because i am having a neighbor learn how to use weed whacker and was so surprised to find that it is extendable and all the way in makes for the right for the 12 year old. It can grow with him. that auto line feed thingy is nice too. and it is bright orange in the right spots so it cant get lost in the deep weeds and grass Follow up review. Much Nicer Than I expected
customer_reviews.author: UpwrdMblty

customer_reviews.title: It takes two to three spools of plastic wire to ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes two to three spools of plastic wire to edge my small lot and the spools run $16 - 20+.
customer_reviews.author: MEV

customer_reviews.title: Iv always used gas items ,never again.
customer_reviews.text: I just love it ,it really cuts my high grass and weed down just as good as the gas weed eater did I love it more because now no gas station trips, what I don't like it that I have to have lots of electric cords hooked up to use ,but it out ways going to gas stations and adding oil to gas too!! love it, My son has electric and I laughed when he used his, now he was so right,,,, smarter than me I guess,hahaaa.Dino in sunny Miami.
customer_reviews.author: Leornard Sclafani

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye weeds!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is so great!!! I had the cheapy as-seen-on-tv one (with zip ties for line!) and that was good for small areas, but we received a notice from the city that our front glass was too tall so we needed something a little more SERIOUS. Aside from getting this just a few short days after ordering, I am extremely pleased with the result, the ease of use and how FUN it is to wack everything. Wooo!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: I found an extension cord that fits this!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned after reading the reviews about how most extension cords don't work with this trimmer because the outlet is recessed. I found an extension cord that fits great so wanted to let you know:
customer_reviews.author: Julianne

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck if the Spool Cap Needs Replaced!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in August 2018. This year the Spool Cap Flew off and broke. I ordered replacement caps on Amazon that said they fit this model ST8600. They DO NOT fit and if your spool cap needs replaced, you have to have it special made by Black and Decker! If I had known this, I would NEVER have purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I received the trimmer less than 48 hours after I ordered it; it took fewer than 10 minutes to assemble and once I found a suitable extension cord, I was in business! The trimmer is very well made, sturdy and works great - very powerful for its size-amperage! For my money, it's one of the best products I've purchased through Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: dave dial

customer_reviews.title: Strong trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I do have some problems with the string , difficult to get it right , the spool is empty in a heart beat , you cant use it wearing shorts , that string is slapping you hard .
customer_reviews.author: Hans J Gerritsen

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great but uses spools way too fast. I went through 3 spools in 1 hour.
customer_reviews.author: Camille Reed

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use - corded operation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the corded version of this to avoid annual gas engine maintenance or dealing with rechargeable batteries. I'm fine dragging an extension cord around. This product is light weight and easy to use. Moreover, it does a good job. The up side is that the string feed is good but the minor downside is it does go through string faster than the previous older models. I'm good with giving up a bit more string for better feeding reliability.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good for a light trimmer...miss the curved form
customer_reviews.text: I had a Grasshog that lasted 8 years which must be some kind of record from what I read about it later. The spooling mechanism definitely broke last year so go this as a replacement for light duty in a small yard. It works fine and is quieter but even though it is lighter, the straight arm makes it more taxing on the back compared to the Grass Hog. We will see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: petekersan

customer_reviews.title: Uses 6' of line per minute!!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer uses about 6' of line per minute. I am trying to return it, but I am about 1 month out of the return window. We'll see what happens. So frustrating adding 20' of line every few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: a great customer

customer_reviews.title: I hope just a broken auto feeder.
customer_reviews.text: I went through 4 spools during my first time using it, before I ran out and couldn’t finish my lawn (standard corner lot, nothing major). Each spool handled 50’ or less of edge. With my previous Black and Decker (battery-powered), a spool lasted me all summer. I understand it is more powerful, but there must be something wrong with the automatic feeder. Black and Decker, please tell me I have a defective unit and replace my unit and 4 spools. Otherwise, it was great. Powerful, destroyed my weeds and edges. I’d give it 5 stars, if it wasn’t for this feed issue.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gourley

customer_reviews.title: whack away
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a powerhouse for such a tiny thing. I'm using it for overgrown weeds with stalks up to 1 inch in diameter. I don't need to extend it but i tested out that feature. I've used it a total of 3 hours (1 hour intervals) and I haven't needed to strange the string or fiddle with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Blaza Lothbrok

customer_reviews.title: Made cheaper than the previous version...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second B&D string trimmer we've purchased. Previous version was easier to use for edging because it had a wheel that you would roll the trimmer along on while you were edging. The "new improved" model no longer has the wheel; instead replaced by a cheap piece of wire. Previous model only lasted three years before the motor quit. I expect this one won't even make that.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Autofeed doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I lost the entire spool during first 15 minutes... you think you may save on the device, but will spend much more money on the spools replacements... It's also pretty noisy and a bit short for a tall person. I bough brushless dewalt instead. it is more expensive, but quiet and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: pyak

customer_reviews.title: Great for weedwacking, subpar for edging
customer_reviews.text: As a weed wacker it works perfectly and was about half the cost as some of the ones advertised locally. Black and Decker is a good brand Using it as an edger was a different story. It chewed through an entire roll of string twice and I ended up getting an electric edger that's just for edging. But if your primary use is weeds then it works great
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Light unit with great cutting ability.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is light weight and powerful enough to get the job done even in higher weeds.What a pleasure to carry this light weight unit around and get the job done a lot faster than heavy gas models that run out of fuel and oil sll the time. and the spool lasts a nice time. Only problem was not with the unit but the pre spooled line comes with tape around it which the glue from it melts causing the line to stick sometimes, (line winders maybe a flat rubber band to hold it?)Otherwise this is the best weed trimmer I have ever used in 40 years.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Roe

customer_reviews.title: Super value on corded trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This corded trimmer - I have three of them - keeps invasive wisteria and other vines in check. Using .08 line cuts even thick vines without getting them wrapped up in the spool bob. I was afraid that corded trimmers would stop being available since the battery-operated ones have gotten better. However, my Worx battery unit will not use .08 line and so gets tangled in trying to cut vines. The B&D is doing an excellent job. I stage all three before cutting in case I run out of line before the job is done. However, that has never happened.
customer_reviews.author: fjp

customer_reviews.title: Weed Eater
customer_reviews.text: Would never buy another one. A piece that holds the spool broke the second time I used it and the string wrapped around my ankle. The injury was so bad it took 6 weeks to heal and has left a large scar. Byer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Shawkey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations of this unit, reputable brand, powerful electric motor. I was disappointed when on my first attempt to cut my modest yard, the motor broke. The internal gears started to chew on the plastic housing, seems the shaft was bent somehow. In my anger, I tossed it in the trash. I won't be looking at Black and Decker in the future. I give it one star because I liked the powerful motor, for all the 30 minutes it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Great for edging
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use / assemble. The guide really helps when it comes to edging, you can sit the guide right where you need to edge and that is where it will edge. The auto feed is also a great feature, I have been using the trimmer for a few weeks and i have had no issues with the auto feed option.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great little trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I'd worn out the last one and this one is an updated version of that. I'm not good at putting things together, but I still had the old one as a guide. The only thing I can criticize (slightly) is that if you're not good at putting things together (like me), just think about the directions and take them one step at a time, and everything will click into place just fine. This is a great little trimmer and I expect it'll last a long time like the last one (-:
customer_reviews.author: Donna Conrady

customer_reviews.title: Short lived
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 7/22. Delivered 7/25. Used 3(?) times. Now, 8/9, the motor's dead. It was awesome at first: strongest electric trimmer I've used, very comparable to gas. Quickly goes through string. Waste of money. IMO, this isn't a disposable (use once and toss) price.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I’m normally a big fan of Black and Decker, but their line trimmers not so much. I bought this in October after the previous B&D trimmer I had stopped auto feeding the line. I’d gotten three years out of it and expected at least that out of this one. But no, it started acting up a month or so ago and finally failed completely. I ended up improvising a manual feed system based on a You Tube video. It’s slower than working autofeed, but way faster than dealing with failed autofeed.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Shreeves

customer_reviews.title: I had a devil of a time....
customer_reviews.text: I had a devil of a time trying to put the guard on it. But I really like it and didn't realize how worn out my 12 year old weed eater was until I fired up this baby. I do dread the day I have to figure out how to replace the line.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Does okay with light weeds and grass. Not so great for edging since the line is so thin. I would get a thicker gauge wire trimmer next time. It will get the job done, but you'll go through a spool fast. Also the spool they include only has like a few feet of wire so buy some extra if you get this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang Theory
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Black and Decker, but I received a Ryobi, as you can see. Worked great for almost two months until today. It has low and high power setting. When I switched to hi power, there was a tremendous bang, and these orange plastic pieces sprayed out into the plastic funnel.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Seubert

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I read about the power cable plug issues and the auto feed issues. I tried it anyways and found a power chord that fits in the receiver plug and the autofeed seems to have worked in my case. I think it was a good purchase after all
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY AMAZON BASICS EXTENSION CORD FOR THIS TRIMMER
customer_reviews.text: Overall works fine, but wish I had read some of the below reviews when I purchased a new extension cord. I have a three-prong cord (Huksy brand) that fits fine, but is too short to reach my whole yard - so I bought the Amazon basics 100 ft cord but one does not fit in the tool when you attempt to plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's easy and it WORKS
customer_reviews.text: We've had a lot of rain here, which translates to weeds and conditions too wet for mowing. Today I assembled this and knocked out all the overgrown weeds in the front yard. It was almost effortless. I'm going to get a longer extension cord and do the back yard! It's light and you don't have to bother with gas or batteries, just plug it in and go. So easy.
customer_reviews.author: *~Stella~*

customer_reviews.title: Biggest waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last all but a week. The guard keep coming off. The spooling mechanism NEVER worked properly. I don't have a good thing to say about it. I used to be a black and decker fan not anymore. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent power and balance.
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered a day earlier than expected! I was in the front yard cleaning out flowerbed when the postal carrier showed up with the package. Attached the guard and fore-handle, plugged it in and away I went! It has some serious power and the balance is excellent to carefully edge around patio, the foundation of our house, and everywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great price & Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Really great trimmer for the price! We used to have a gas trimmer and that thing weighed way too much for me (a female that doesn’t work out arms lol), I was always switching arms with it. This trimmer is much light and I don’t get tired as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey M.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Broke after six weeks of light use. Haven't had the auto-spool issues that people noted. I ran out of line today, changed it out, and ten seconds after spinning it up again the motor stopped and the button does nothing. Dead as a doornail. Tried a different outlet, zero response. Checked the cord, works fine. I assume the motor died. Just past the return period, so my investment in the trimmer and all the extra trimmer string are down the drain. Will try to deal with B&D support, but I'm not optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: William Seale

customer_reviews.title: Working great.
customer_reviews.text: Got sick of trying to maintain the old gas trimmer. As long as you don't mind dealing with the cord, this is perfect. Edit: Lowered to 3 stars since the autofeed failed after about 10 to 15 hours of use. It would use a full spool in just minutes. I glued the auto feed part and now just hand feed as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime user

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Owned one before, didn’t need the first one and gave it to a friend. Now we need one and this is a good brand. The line feed is the worst part of the trimmer. I would have given it 5 stars if not for the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!!!! I NORMALLY LIKE BLACK AND DECKER PRODUCTS BUT SOMEONE REALLY DROPPED THE BALL ON THIS ONE. THE AUTOMATIC FEED DOES NOT WORK. AT ALL. EVER. AS MUCH AS YOU TIGHTEN THE HEAD ONTO THE MAIL SHAFT IT STILL ROTATES INTO AWKWARD POSITIONS. EVEN IF THEY GAVE ME THIS FOR FREE I WOULD NOT USE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Lucretia Stoops

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this. I’ve always used gas but decided to give electric a try since I’ve had issues with gas ones breaking down so I was a little skeptical but this thing is great!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect much
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived late .. and although the box was not damages the contents were now I got to send it all the way back .. killer is it wasn’t expensive so it’s hardly worth shipping .. and by the time I get it working the weeds will be taller than me . :( and finally after I fallowed the instruction and drove to a nearby town to ups this back .. they did not credit my debit card but instead gave me a gift card .. I don’t want
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk- the auto feed doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: auto feed doesn't work at all! We have about .25 acre and have already replaced the string about 10 times before giving up. Returning and buying a better brand. Not worth your time or energy unless you literally have a few feet to weedwack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonmom

customer_reviews.title: ... black handle likes to pop out of its position pretty regularly.
customer_reviews.text: The black handle likes to pop out of its position pretty regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Fiscella

customer_reviews.title: Wacking my way to China!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a lot. POSITIVE: It wacks my weeds well. Easy to use. NEGETIVE: It is made for shorter humanoids. I dont see any shaft extension options. Did i miss something? I am 6ft tall and its a bit short for me. I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: guitarmike82

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: I live in a big city and have some weeds that grow around a tree and through the concrete cracks. Handles these well. I've gotten some semi thick stuff too. Changing the string isn't hard. But the cord situation is a little strange. You have to get a specific one or an adapter that will fit. If you don't know these things, you should just take it to the hardware store and ask what will work with it.
customer_reviews.author: S. l.

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the motor cover off
customer_reviews.text: Mine started smelling like burning rubber so I figure there's grass or weeds that got into the motor. But I can't get the case open to clean it out or even look to see what the problem might be. I've only had this 2.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer designed to accept 2 pin extension.But you can Override with a 3 pin ext:cord with a trick.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is designed accept 2 pins extension . But you can Override if you have three pin extension cord. In the three pin extension just trim the upper and lower bumps and it will easily fit in to it..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 10 minutes plus safety issue
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer fell apart after 10 minutes of light use. The cap on the reel disintergrated and got flung across the yard. A long metal spring went shooting out.
customer_reviews.author: rhchel

customer_reviews.title: Uses too much line
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Toro trimmer I had for about 20 years and am so tremendously disappointed. I don't know if it has too much power or if the recommended line is too thin but I go through so much more line now than I did with my prior trimmer. On top of that, I can't get the line to come out the way it's supposed to so I have to flip it upside down, open it up, and manually pull the line out. I'm hoping this trimmer doesn't last as long as my last one -- I don't want to be dealing with these issues that long!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Ingenthron

customer_reviews.title: Regret buying this
customer_reviews.text: I wish i had just paid more for a decent one. After the first few times using it a piece broke off so the string would just all come out at once. I've spent hours trying to fix/figure it out. Now it won't even work at all. So annoyed. I would never recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Arwenona

customer_reviews.title: Wow! It's powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my battery B&D because batteries lose their charge quickly and wasn't really powerful. I didnt want gas/oil problems, noise, pulling on starter cords with a gas whacked. This corded electric is more powerful than i expected, no trouble with the line auto-feed.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C.

customer_reviews.title: Designed for proprietory replacement spools of string.
customer_reviews.text: Nice motor. Powerful. Quiet. Lightweight. I liked all of these. I do not like how the design is set up for purchasing proprietary spools of string rather than refilling them yourself. Also the guard wasn't as adjustable as it could be to protect my feet. I am right-handed.
customer_reviews.author: Rudd Bagus

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I received the order and it is so easy - my 17 year old son loves it - chopped a couple of leaves off my lemon tree - but that is besides the point - I needed this (especially during this pandemic time). Very good, sturdy trimmer - easy to rotate and lock into place. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Nyla

customer_reviews.title: POWER!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power and easy enough to assemble. Have not had to load spare strong yet so can not comment ob that aspect yet. Ive done my yard twice so far and if you use as directed, there is plenty of string to get the job done quickly and with out reloading
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that it's not good for tall people. I'm 5'4" fits me perfectly. Hubby is 6'4" and he has issues.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Duff

customer_reviews.title: Uses too much line!
customer_reviews.text: I can't afford the line for this trimmer, it runs out constantly. I have a mountian home with little lawn, just weeds and a little trimming, it takes 2 or 3 spools just to get the job done. I'm buying a new trimmer, not this kind.
customer_reviews.author: Dall

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER String Trimmer / Edger, 13-Inch, 5-Amp (ST8600)
product_meta.description: Style:String TrimmerPerformance to power through the toughest weeds, grass and overgrowth with a 5.0 amp motor and POWERDRIVE transmission. AUTOMATIC FEED SPOOL - AFS automatically feeds trimmer line as needed. Adjustable height and pivoting handle positions. Edge guide provides precise edging. Prevent accidental cord disconnection as you work with cord retention system.
feature_bullets: Performance to power through the toughest weeds, grass and overgrowth with a 5.0 amp motor and POWERDRIVE transmission
AUTOMATIC FEED SPOOL AFS automatically feeds trimmer line as needed
Adjustable height and pivoting handle positions
Edge guide provides precise edging. RPM: 7700 rpm
Prevent accidental cord disconnection as you work with cord retention system
Included Components: (1) ST8600 13 inches string trimmer/Edger, (1) AF 100 Spool, (1) Guard, (1) Auxiliary Handle; Power source: Corded electric

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,861 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
